content: Obama and electronic monitor device for energy consumption, and the new industry that it will fuel.. also how people will some day be able to sell electricity back using these devices. Okay with the premise that i am 100 percent behind research into energy creation and efficient utilization; the man has some fundamental flaws If your consumption of energy is too high then there are many things you can do. No not going to list them but the list is large. And electric companies already have utilized this system to control during peak demands. and they on the whole have abandoned the practice. There used to be a system that during peak hours could monitor your heat/air pump and water heater and shut them down or back them off during peak hours. turned out to be pretty expensive to maintain and it just did not work, i had this system in my house for years.. Obama also said today that people would be able to sell surplus power with the new equipment, does anyone here have any idea how many solar panels are required to do something like this?? I do, I lived with solar panels and wind generators for ten years, and remember the system is directly porportional (more requires bigger!!) I say fund research but dont sell a pipe dream that everyone will have a little magic electronic box, a few solar panels and be energy dependant. aint gonna happen not at this time, nor in the near future either "http://greenbydesign.com/2009/02/19/are-obama-and-google-stimulating-the-smart-energy-sector/" here is some more information, this is not new technology and has been around for a long long time

content: quote: Originally posted by SeaWitch1220: Does anyone remember California in the 70s, LA especially? The SMOG was so thick that there were days people were told not to leave their homes. California's strict emission laws and other regulations have made a HUGE difference in the air quality here. California is going to lead the way in green jobs. The rest will be playing catch up. I remember California in the sixties and it was dreadful. I kid you not, but I had been living in Gardena for a month before I saw the San Gabriel mountains! They're just right there, on the north side of the basin, but obscured by haze and pollution. At the time, I worked up on Slauson and driving to work one, clear morning, it took a little while to realize something was different. Oh, WOW! LOOK! There's mountains right there! By the end of the work day, the air down around Signal Hill in Long Beach was downright brown. In fact, it looked like dirt suspended in the air and whole LA basin smelled like rotten fruit, all the time. Yes, California has come a long way since then, and it's been painful, but well worth it.

During his first 50 days in office, he and his Democratic-controlled Congress spent $1 billion an hour. Seems that one flaw leands itself to another... I love how y'all like to accuse him of not sticking to his campaign promises. That's disingenous, at best. Why? Because he campaigned for over a year addressing issues based upon the assumption that things would go on about like they were. Then, suddenly, a month before the election, the economy fell apart and everything he'd been addressing went right out the window. It did for ALL the candidates, yet somehow, all the things Obama promised without realizing he'd inherit an economy down the tubes are suddenly sacro-sanct and anything he's done in reaction to that unexpected crisis are "lies" if it's not what he was talking about before the collapse.

content: quote: Originally posted by Ira1945: Obama and electronic monitor device for energy consumption, and the new industry that it will fuel.. also how people will some day be able to sell electricity back using these devices. Okay with the premise that i am 100 percent behind research into energy creation and efficient utilization; the man has some fundamental flaws If your consumption of energy is too high then there are many things you can do. No not going to list them but the list is large. And electric companies already have utilized this system to control during peak demands. and they on the whole have abandoned the practice. Nope, they haven't. To start with , they're still browning people and bussiness out in most places to lower the load on the system. The also require large users to "voluntary" shut off equipment till the load is lower to the point the rest of the grid can stay on. There used to be a system that during peak hours could monitor your heat/air pump and water heater and shut them down or back them off during peak hours. turned out to be pretty expensive to maintain and it just did not work, i had this system in my house for years..The "new" systems are cheaper and work better. Obama also said today that people would be able to sell surplus power with the new equipment, does anyone here have any idea how many solar panels are required to do something like this?? Depends on the amount of power your house needs, the number of the new, more efficent solor panels you want. The number of batterys you want and the amount of money you want to spend I do, I lived with solar panels and wind generators for ten years, and remember the system is directly porportional (more requires bigger!!)But the new and improved units mean the systems can make more energy for the same size your use to. I say fund research but dont sell a pipe dream that everyone will have a little magic electronic box, a few solar panels and be energy dependant. aint gonna happen. So, we should just take you word for it... why? not at this time, nor in the near future either. So of coure "you" are able to see the future and you feel there's no reson to try to improve the systems or change the system to make us less dependant on the needs we have today? content: Obama and electronic monitor device for energy consumption, and the new industry that it will fuel.. also how people will some day be able to sell electricity back using these devices. Okay with the premise that i am 100 percent behind research into energy creation and efficient utilization; the man has some fundamental flaws If your consumption of energy is too high then there are many things you can do. No not going to list them but the list is large. And electric companies already have utilized this system to control during peak demands. and they on the whole have abandoned the practice. There used to be a system that during peak hours could monitor your heat/air pump and water heater and shut them down or back them off during peak hours. turned out to be pretty expensive to maintain and it just did not work, i had this system in my house for years.. Obama also said today that people would be able to sell surplus power with the new equipment, does anyone here have any idea how many solar panels are required to do something like this?? I do, I lived with solar panels and wind generators for ten years, and remember the system is directly porportional (more requires bigger!!) I say fund research but dont sell a pipe dream that everyone will have a little magic electronic box, a few solar panels and be energy dependant. aint gonna happen not at this time, nor in the near future either "http://greenbydesign.com/2009/02/19/are-obama-and-google-stimulating-the-smart-energy-sector/" here is some more information, this is not new technology and has been around for a long long time

I remember California in the sixties and it was dreadful. I kid you not, but I had been living in Gardena for a month before I saw the San Gabriel mountains! They're just right there, on the north side of the basin, but obscured by haze and pollution. At the time, I worked up on Slauson and driving to work one, clear morning, it took a little while to realize something was different. Oh, WOW! LOOK! There's mountains right there! By the end of the work day, the air down around Signal Hill in Long Beach was downright brown. In fact, it looked like dirt suspended in the air and whole LA basin smelled like rotten fruit, all the time. Yes, California has come a long way since then, and it's been painful, but well worth it.

content: quote: Originally posted by Ira1945: Obama and electronic monitor device for energy consumption, and the new industry that it will fuel.. also how people will some day be able to sell electricity back using these devices. Okay with the premise that i am 100 percent behind research into energy creation and efficient utilization; the man has some fundamental flaws If your consumption of energy is too high then there are many things you can do. No not going to list them but the list is large. And electric companies already have utilized this system to control during peak demands. and they on the whole have abandoned the practice. Nope, they haven't. To start with , they're still browning people and bussiness out in most places to lower the load on the system. The also require large users to "voluntary" shut off equipment till the load is lower to the point the rest of the grid can stay on. There used to be a system that during peak hours could monitor your heat/air pump and water heater and shut them down or back them off during peak hours. turned out to be pretty expensive to maintain and it just did not work, i had this system in my house for years..The "new" systems are cheaper and work better. Obama also said today that people would be able to sell surplus power with the new equipment, does anyone here have any idea how many solar panels are required to do something like this?? Depends on the amount of power your house needs, the number of the new, more efficent solor panels you want. The number of batterys you want and the amount of money you want to spend I do, I lived with solar panels and wind generators for ten years, and remember the system is directly porportional (more requires bigger!!)But the new and improved units mean the systems can make more energy for the same size your use to. I say fund research but dont sell a pipe dream that everyone will have a little magic electronic box, a few solar panels and be energy dependant. aint gonna happen.
